They said that this mandatory overtime would last from the end of Nov to early Dec, but they extended it with less than a 3-day notice and it lasted until almost the end of Dec and called it off only to return to mandatory overtime again for another 3 weeks in January. Had they been honest from the start I don't think I would be as infuriated. 

Night shift associates get paid a nighttime differential because they work nights and get about 1.50 more an hour vs day shift associates. Night-time MANAGERS get paid the same amount as daytime MANAGERS which is incredibly unfair since I literally never see the light of day. I have gotten sick so many times because of the hours I work. The recruiter also said that moving up and laterally is super easy in this company, which was true to a certain degree - until they changed the policy. You have to stay at least a year in a position before making an internal transfer and if you get a promotion in that time, you have to stay in that position another year before you can transfer.

Furthermore, they didn't tell me what shift I would be on until 2 days before I started and I had to shift my sleep schedule literally 12 hours in two days.

Their 401k is also the worst thing I have ever seen in my life. They give you 50 cents for every dollar you put in - UP TO TWO PERCENT COMPANY CONTRIBUTION. So essentially it doesn't matter if I put in 4% or 10%, they will only contribute 2%. 

So, some advice for anyone who is considering taking this job - unless you want to be underpaid, overworked, and lied to, this job is for you.
